result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin F Ireland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kevin F Ireland in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense withdraws motion.

Plea Colloquy.  

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed  Sentence of:

125 Days Jail CONCURRENT TO SENTENCE BEING SERVED

Costs: $268.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
Provide DNA Sample if not yet provided.
(To be paid forthwith.  Alternate 10 days.  Court orders alternate consecutive to sentence imposed.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
